item.title: Two new papers in Phys. Rev. E
item.description:
The papers entitled “Exact analytical solution of irreversible binary dynamics on network” and “Geometric evolution of complex networks” have been accepted and published in Phys. Rev. E. The latter introduces a new geometric model of complex networks. In doing so, we interpolate and quantify the phase transition of the network structure between the random and geomtric phases; where the clustering coefficient goes from zero to a fixed constant.

Links to the full texts, preprints and software are available on the publication page.

item.title: 5000 downloads!
item.description: My Garmin watch face has just hit a new major step! For the occasion, I’ve created a unique background header for this post. Enjoy!

item.title: New website!
item.description:
My personal website has been updated with a new architecture and design. The website is in jekyll and the theme is adapted from centrarium. I’ve erased the posts before March 2017.

In the news page, I’ve placed an animation (made with d3.js and may not work on all devices) to catch the eyes. The animation is different each time the page is reloaded. Compared to the old website, a portfolio tabs has been added. Take a look!

item.title: Exact solution of binary dynamics
item.description: I’m proud to release a paper called Exact analytical solution of irreversible binary dynamics on networks. Our contribution is analytic and numerical in nature. We obtain an analytical solution to cascade dynamics and propose an algorithm to solve the equations as efficiently as possible. We made available the code solving the equations.

item.title: Annual Sentinel North Conference
item.description: After weeks of work, my study of the networks of Sentinel North has finally been presented by Patrick Desrosiers at the annual Sentinel North conference. I also had the opportunity to give a blitz talk of three minutes, a unique opportunity to practice communication skills.

item.title: CINQ summer school
item.description: On May 15 and 16, I was assisting a summer school on the connectivity of the brain. The Domain Cataraqui has been well chosen to host the school and provided a quiet environment.

item.title: FRQNT
item.description: On the same day of my doctorate exam, I was awarded a scholarship by Fonds de recherche du Québec - Nature et technologies to pursue my PhD. This scholarship is awarded based on the research track record of the candidates, as well as the quality and originality of their proposed work.

item.title: Doctoral exam
item.description: On Friday, I have completed my doctoral exam. The evaluation is based on two documents presenting my future research, and an oral presentation. I can now continue and pursue active research.

item.title: IV Mediterranean School of Complex Networks
item.description: In September, I will attend a (late) summer school in Sicily, Italy. The four major themes of the school are closely related to my research interests: complex networks, nonlinear dynamics, synchronization and biological systems. Among the invited experts are Alex Arenas, Tiago Peixoto and Vito Latora.

item.title: Byron-T. Darling scholarship
item.description: I’ve been selected to receive the Byron-T. Darling scholarship of 5000$. I am grateful for this generous encouragement to pursue my research.
